Follow Conventional Commits strictly and start with a relevant gitmoji.

Note: Do NOT wrap the final commit message in code fences. Code blocks below are examples only.

Template (no surrounding backticks in the final message):

```plaintext
<gitmoji> <type>(optional-scope): <short, imperative description>

[optional closed issues]
[optional body]
```

Rules

1) Header
- Exactly one gitmoji at the start (see mapping below)
- type is a valid Conventional Commit type in lowercase
- scope is optional; if present, use parentheses: feat(doc), fix(ci)
- combine scopes with + (e.g., ci+doc)
- description is imperative, concise, no trailing period
- target â‰² 72 chars total for the header

2) Allowed types
- feat, fix, docs, ci, refactor, perf, test, build, chore, revert, style

3) Allowed scopes
- lib, doc, ci â€” or combine with + (e.g., ci+doc)

4) Gitmoji suggestions (pick one that fits best)
- âœ¨ feat
- ğŸ› fix
- ğŸ“ docs
- ğŸ‘· ci
- â™»ï¸ refactor
- âš¡ï¸ perf
- âœ… test
- ğŸ—ï¸ build
- ğŸ”§ chore
- âª revert
- ğŸ¨ style

1) Closed issues (optional)
- Put on a separate line after the header
- Format: Closes #123 or Fixes #123 (multiple: Closes #123, #456)

1) Body (optional, top 3 bullets only)
- Use - bullet points
- Include only the most important details (max 3 bullets)
- Max 60 chars per bullet
- Use backticks for code/identifiers when useful

Examples (copy as-is, without fences)

âœ¨ feat(fe): add `Provider` error boundary to avoid crash

Closes #221
- Catch runtime errors and show fallback UI
- Log to `tlog` with masked data
- Add tests for error cases

ğŸ› fix(be): prevent nil deref in `ShareService`

- Guard on nil repo result
- Add unit test covering edge case

ğŸ‘· ci: speed up frontend tests with `--timeout 10000`

- Align with repo testing rules
- Reduce flakiness with reruns

Checklist for Copilot
- Starts with exactly one appropriate gitmoji
- Uses a valid type and optional scope in parentheses
- Imperative, concise header; no trailing period
- Body â‰¤ 3 bullets, each â‰¤ 60 chars (if present)
- Closed issues line present when relevant (Closes/Fixes #)
